title: Sienna Miller admits she found wearing a fat suit and prosthetics in The Loudest Voice 'liberating'
text:
Sienna Miller found wearing a fat suit in The Loudest Voice a 'liberating' experience.

The British actress, 37, starred as Beth Ailes, the wife of former Fox News CEO Roger Ailes, in the TV mini-series and underwent four hours of prosthetics every day while filming to transform into character.

Appearing on This Morning on Thursday, Sienna told how she enjoyed the experience because it made both she and co-star Russell Crowe, 55, 'unrecognisable'.

Scroll down for video.

'Liberating': Sienna Miller appeared on This Morning on Thursday and detailed the 'liberating' feeling of transforming for her recent role in The Loudest Voice

She explained of the role: 'Russell Crowe had a lot [prosthetics] on. It was a four-hour job, everyday for a long time.

'For the first three days I was laughing a lot, we were completely unrecognisable. But I found it liberating as it's a mask.'

The drama charted the executive's career and the allegations of sexual harassment against him.

Sienna previously spoke to Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show about her experience of wearing prosthetics for The Loudest Voice.

Unrecognisable: The British actress, 37, starred as Beth Ailes, the wife of former Fox News CEO Roger Ailes, in the TV mini-series, and underwent four hours of prosthetics every day

Amazing: Sienna told how she enjoyed the experience because it made both she and co-star Russell Crowe, 55, (pictured in character) 'unrecognisable'

Plenty to talk about: The Layer Cake star was appearing on the daytime show following the release of her latest film, American Woman

She said: 'It's four hours of prosthetics. It's pretty amazing. I found it quite funny at first because you literally cannot recognise yourself at first. So it's quite a weird experience.'

Ailes was named chairman of Fox News in 2005 and, following his resignation, became an advisor to Donald Trump's presidential campaign where he assisted with debate preparation.

He died in 2017 aged 77 after falling and hitting his head at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

Others who appeared in The Loudest Voice include Naomi Watts, who played Gretchen Carlson, the former Fox News anchor who filed a lawsuit against Ailes in July 2016, claiming sexual harassment.

Talented: The movie tells the tale of the disappearance of a woman's teen daughter in a small Pennsylvania town

Emotional: Debra, portrayed by Sienna, is left to raise her infant grandson alone, with the story spanning 11 years in her life (pictured)

The Layer Cake star was appearing on the daytime show following the release of her latest film, American Woman.

Sienna appears alongside Mad Men's Christina Hendricks, 44, and the movie tells the tale of the disappearance of a woman's teen daughter in a small Pennsylvania town.

Debra, portrayed by Sienna, is left to raise her infant grandson alone, with the story spanning 11 years in her life.

Sienna admitted the tale was particularly poignant to her as a mother to daughter Marlowe, seven, who she shares with her actor ex Tom Sturridge, 33.

Speaking of her preparation for the role, she said: 'It’s empowering. She's very funny and very brave as well. I spoke to a lot of people who had missing children l and I spoke to one woman, Vicky Kelly, who had lost her son.

Intense: Sienna admitted the tale was particularly poignant to her as a mother to daughter Marlowe, seven, who she shares with her actor ex Tom Sturridge, 33

'This film was dedicated to him. It was unimaginable [what parents were going through] but I got to go home to my daughter at the end of the day… it's all of our worst nightmare. I'm terrified of that happening.'

The actress also spoke of her bond with Christina - who played her screen sister - praising her as a 'fantastic' co-star.

Sienna told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: 'It was amazing, she's a fantastic actress. The sibling relationship is at the heart of the film.

'When we just met, we were rehearsing for two weeks. The director asked us to put make-up on each other as it's something we might have done as children.

'I was really game, but it was mortifying because Christina turned around and said, "To be honest, that would just pull us apart".'
